results.title: Eating your heart out
results.creator_credit: Chris Warner, Maureen McCarthy and Trout Films
results.brief_description: A study of food, dieting and obsessional eating especially as they affect women and girls in Western societies. Examines a number of eating disorders such as anorexia nervosa, bulimia, obesity and the condition known as the fat thin woman as well as wider social pressures that lead to obsessions about eating. Narrated by Beverly Dunn, music by Mark McSherry, photographed by Jaems Grant.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Chris Warner, Maureen McCarthy and Trout Films

results.title: Jumping molecules!
results.creator_credit: Christopher Haws, Michael Latham and Landmark Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Start Here: Adventures into Science”.
Konrad, the kitchen robot, shows how the energy in heat may be used to demonstrate the fundamentals of physics. Focuses on temperature and presents experiments using common household materials involving the kitchen refrigerator, cold water and hot water.

results.title: Make a noise
results.creator_credit: Christopher Haws, Michael Latham and Landmark Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Start Here: Adventures into Science”.
Explains what sound is and why some sounds are musical. Shows how to experiment with vibrations and to create music. This programme is suitable for upper primary science.

results.title: Mix a material
results.creator_credit: Christopher Haws, Michael Latham, Landmark Films and Video Arts
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Start Here: Adventures into Science”.
Looks at why materials bend, stretch and break. Demonstrates experiments to show the behaviour of molecular lattices in everyday substances from chocolate to rubber ballons.

results.title: More new handwriting
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Diane O'Connor and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Three related programs by Barbara Nichol on the teaching of the new handwriting style for Victorian government schools. 1.”The New handwriting”. Provides an introduction to the new handwriting course for all members of the school community. 2.”Learning handwriting”. Highlights the reasons for implementing the course. 3.”Victorian modern cursive”. Provides a demostration of the course.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jeff Spencer, Diane O’Connor and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development

results.title: Partners in design
results.creator_credit: John Mills and Formula One Films
results.brief_description: Looks at the design of a new image and packaging concept for a range of toilet products soon to be marketed. Shows the range of Letraset materials and their application.

results.title: The Liberated letter
results.creator_credit: John Mills, American Library Association, Formula One Films and Letraset International
results.brief_description: Presents a brief history of the development of lettering, the invention of the printing press and the more recent invention of phototypesetting. Shows the production of Letraset instant lettering and some of the styles available.

results.title: Soil and water: a living world
results.creator_credit: Greg Johnson, Greg Logan, Barr Films and Sandler Institutional Films
results.brief_description: Four children are guided on a scientific adventure looking at the living world of soil and water. Explains how topsoil and water are full of plant and animal life called organisms. Indicates types of activities that can be carried out with these two common natural substances.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Greg Johnson, Greg Logan, Barr Films and Sandler Institutional Films

results.title: The Laser beam
results.creator_credit: Leo A. Handel and Handel Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Uses animation to explain the principle of the laser. Shows some of the applications of lasers in medicine, industry, communications, space exploration and the holograms that may lead to three-dimensional television. Traces the history of lasers and shows how emission spectra and lasers are related. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
